author: Business Insider
description:
A 64-year-old man in Maryland has spent decades turning a childhood toy into the world’s most valuable Hot Wheels collection. What started as playtime in the 1960s is now a treasure trove worth millions — filled with ultra-rare cars, limited editions, and prototypes.

In this video, we go inside his collection to uncover how he built it, why these tiny die-cast cars are worth so much, and how Hot Wheels grew from a kid’s toy to a billion-dollar business powered by adult fans.

Business Insider tells you all you need to know about business, finance, tech, retail, and more.

CHAPTERS:
00:00 - Introduction
01:14 - The Biggest Hot Wheels Collection
02:34 - The Origin of Hot Wheels
05:52 - Inside Bruce's Hot Wheels museum
06:42 - How Mattels designs cars
08:03 - Bruce's rarest cars
11:29 - York Toy Extravaganza
14:19 - The future of Hot Wheels collecting
15:27 - Credits
